intro: Thelycrania iberica, commonly known as the Iberian thelycrania, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that form a basal rosette. Thelycrania iberica is a rare species, facing threats from habitat loss and over-collection.
